{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3474635,"name":"","username":"Akaswan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-07T23:33:22.421Z","cooked":"

I’ve been looking at the new REVLib API and noticed that even though they implemented a trapezoidal motion profile that uses position control, the only feedforward you can input into the config is Kf which is just Kv from what I’ve read. Even further, they discourage you from using their “kF” entirely when using MAXMotion:

image758×51 4.61 KB

On top of this, they don’t expose the velocity and acceleration setpoints in the API, meaning you can’t calculate the feedforward on the RIO. And even if you could, you can only input a static value for arbitrary feedforward when calling the setReference() method, which when using a motion profile is only called once, when the profile first starts.

If you plan on using Rev motor controllers this year how do you plan on implementing your motion profiles? Will you disregard feedforward entirely like REV recommends, or will you calculate the profile on the RIO, giving you access to add the feedforward into the setReference() method? Or is there a way to add feedforward using MAXMotion that I have just missed?

Does anyone know if REV plans to change their API to let users input kV, kA, kS, and kG, and be able to configure between elevator, arm, or simple feedforward?

I’ll need to see a lot more documentation on MaxMotion details before I use it.
JavaDocs documentation doesn’t cut it.

This is a song I’ve been singing for a while.

Either REV doesn’t know what Kv, Ka, etc are or they don’t know how to implement it on the controller or they don’t care to.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T15:54:55.302Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":82.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3490725,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T15:56:29.945Z","cooked":"

In fact the reason they discourage using KF (kv) for position motion is that their controller uses kF against the setpoint not the velocity setpoint. So in position control this would be the position setpoint.

This is effectively smart motion with configurable acceleration and velocity maxes

Our feedforward control is already in software now. At this point im questioning why not just do everything in software

Akaswan:

And even if you could, you can only input a static value for arbitrary feedforward when calling the setReference() method, which when using a motion profile is only called once, when the profile first start

oh, geez. this is news to me. I was under the impression we could continuously recommand it with our arm’s current position.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T21:27:21.627Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499335,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T21:56:04.555Z","cooked":"

You can; nothing has changed there. It’s still useless for applying a dynamic feedforward without access to the internal profile point to calculate it.

narmstro:

This is effectively smart motion with configurable acceleration and velocity maxes

No; the loop is properly closed on position now so it should perform substantially better than SmartMortion.

It still seems to have some major shortcomings, though.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T21:57:17.990Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":74.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20003,"username":"joemost","name":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/7","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499364,"name":"Martin Nemaric","username":"Martini159","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/278dde/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T22:10:07.029Z","cooked":"

Honestly we’ve had a really good experience with it so far on a shortish arm/wrist! Also appreciate how easy it is to implement.

But can imagine on a longer or heavier arm that not having velocity and gravity feedforward would be a deal-breaker though.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T22:10:07.029Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":83.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Martin Nemaric","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56673,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499926,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T16:46:24.932Z","cooked":"
narmstro:

Either REV doesn’t know what Kv, Ka, etc are or they don’t know how to implement it on the controller or they don’t care to.

To come back to this for a moment - please appreciate that software development is not free. CTRE charges a subscription model for some of their features, which bankrolls development for their whole API. REV has no such model.

It is still perfectly possible to use REV products for high-fidelity control, but it takes a bit more effort. I do not think this is because REV is not aware of the state-of-the-art, or that they just “don’t care to.” They have decided not to invest the money required to make this ergonomic, yet.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T16:46:24.932Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":156.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/9","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500550,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T12:14:08.209Z","cooked":"

I agree with you in principle but I believe the reality you are imposing isn’t the case for REV. They have a pretty solid stake in the FTC/FRC market. While I’m not privy to all of their business dealings they are effectively the default motor controller for many teams. I don’t think their bank account is suffering all that much in a way to not implement some internal feedforward mechanism that parallels CTRE’s

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T12:14:08.209Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500593,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T13:57:25.981Z","cooked":"

It’s not a question of whether their bank account is suffering; it’s a question of financial incentives. No matter how small the cost compared to their profits, if it doesn’t concretely lead to more sales then there’s no reason to do it.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T13:57:25.981Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":65.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500639,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T14:49:15.355Z","cooked":"

FYI:

After some discussion with others we are probably going to stick to position mode and run the profile on the rio… basically the same model rev used in 2023

we ran the rev max motion with okay results. We might retry factoring in the velocity of the feedforward as well

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T14:49:15.355Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":479978,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/REVrobotics/2023-REV-ION-FRC-Starter-Bot/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/ArmSubsystem.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2023-REV-ION-FRC-Starter-Bot/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/ArmSubsystem.java at main · REVrobotics/2023-REV-ION-FRC-Starter-Bot · GitHub","clicks":54}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-max-motion-with-feedforward/479978/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500659,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T15:20:04.048Z","cooked":"

I have to insert my usual plug for open source software here. if the controller firmware were open, you could just make it do what you’re asking for, yourself.

I think there are important and difficult safety issues surrounding that idea, to be sure. if we could find a way to safely support more openness at the controller level, we could tap in to the neighboring ecosystems like VESC or ODrive.

truher:

if we could find a way to safely support more openness at the controller level, we could tap in to the neighboring ecosystems like VESC or ODrive

you know, I was kinda wondering this too. FRC/FTC is huge but its not like this is the only thing that needs these capabilities in DC Motor control. I’m sure in other fields they are controlling these motors with similar needs in mind.

While I wholeheartedly with the sentiment, it should be noted that CTRE had MotionMagic for years prior to phoenix pro’s introduction.

So I wouldn’t necessarily say that particular feature is a result of their subscription funding scheme, though the modern phoenix-6 API which surrounds it may be.

RomanTechPlus:

While I wholeheartedly with the sentiment, it should be noted that CTRE had MotionMagic for years prior to phoenix pro’s introduction.

During those years they did not have a feedforward of the type that is desired here. They did expose the internal profile setpoint, but that wasn’t ultimately that much more convenient than just doing the motion planning on the RIO - which you can still do with REV today.
